Application.Apps.DAC.Hardware_Control.DAC_80508¶

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

DAC_80508

Class for the used Octal DAC 80508 from Ti
class DAC_80508(cs_pin, spi, muxer)[source]¶

Class for the used Octal DAC 80508 from Ti Datasheet: https://www.ti.com/lit/ds/symlink/dac80508.pdf?ts=1619120994235&ref_url=https%253A%252F%252Fwww.ti.com%252Fproduct%252FDAC80508 Initialises the DAC. Sets Internal Voltage Reference Gain to 2

Parameters

  • cs_pin (int) – The Output Line of the Multiplexer which is connected to the DAC

  • spi (SpiDev spi) – The SPI Interface to be used for communication

  • muxer (Multiplexer Object) – The Multiplexer which controls the CS Routing

read(self, reg)[source]¶

Low Level one Register read function. Selects MUX Line Selects correct SPI Mode Gets the Data from the Register like described in the Datasheet

Parameters

reg (int) – The Register which should be read

Returns

Value of the 16 bit Register as an Integer

Return type

int

write(self, reg, value)[source]¶

Low Level Register Write Function. Selects MUX Line Selects correct SPI Mode Writes the Value to the specified Register like described in the Datasheet :param reg: The Register to be written to :type reg: int :param value: The Value to be written to the Register :type value: int

get_device_id(self)[source]¶

Gets the Device ID of the DAC should always be 517

voltage_to_LSB(self, voltage)[source]¶

Converts the voltage to the nearest corresponding LSB Value. The LSB Value is estimated by the gain and full voltage range.

Parameters

voltage (float) – The voltage that should be converted to LSB

Returns

LSB Value corresponding to Voltage

Return type

int

LSB_to_voltage(self, voltage_LSB)[source]¶

Converts the voltage in LSB to a estimated float Voltage in Volts.

Parameters

voltage_LSB (int) – Voltage in LSB to be converted in Volts

Returns

Voltage in Volts

Return type

float

set_voltage(self, channel, voltage)[source]¶

Sets the DAC channel (0-7) to the desired voltage

Parameters

  • channel (int) – Channel 0-7 which should be set

  • voltage (float) – Voltage the channel should be set to

Returns

The estimated Voltage which is set

Return type

float

get_voltage_LSB(self, channel)[source]¶

Gets the set voltage of a specified channel in LSB

Parameters

channel (int) – Channel of which the voltage Register should be read

Returns

Value of Voltage Register of the specified channel

Return type

int

get_voltage(self, channel)[source]¶

Gets the estimated set voltage of a specified channel in Volts

Parameters

channel (int) – Channel of which the voltage Register should be read and converted

Returns

in Volts Converted Value of Voltage Register of the specified channel

Return type

float

get_all_voltages(self)[source]¶

Gets the estimated set voltage of all channels in Volts

Returns

in Volts Converted Values of Voltage Registers of all channels

Return type

list of float

set_all_gain(self, gain_x2=True)[source]¶

Sets the gain to two of all DAC Channels -> Voltage Range between 0-5V using the internal Voltage Reference (2.5V)

Parameters

gain_x2 (bool, optional) – Whether to set the Gain to two or not. Defaults to True.
